title: How to Use Scissors in Gimp

steps.title: Make sure you are on the intelligent scissors tool.
steps.content: Make sure you are on the intelligent scissors tool. They look like a pair of scissors.

steps.title: Make sure you are on the layer you wish to make a selection in.
steps.content: Make sure you are on the layer you wish to make a selection in. To do this, simply click on that layer in the layers and channels box.

steps.title: Click to create a starting point (or anchor) of the thing you want to select.
steps.content: Click to create a starting point (or anchor) of the thing you want to select. Click around the object you want to select. Notice that the lines curve and zigzag sometimes to get the correct selection.

steps.title: Once you have gone around the object, put the mouse on on the first point created.
steps.content: Once you have gone around the object, put the mouse on on the first point created. An infinity sign should come up (looks like a sideways "eight"). Click on this point to complete the selection.

steps.title: After this is done, put your mouse inside the selection.
steps.content: After this is done, put your mouse inside the selection. An image of a dotted circle should show up. Click inside the circle to create the selection.
